intro: Dischidia deschampsii, commonly known as the creeping fig, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and fleshy, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. It is well adapted to humid, tropical environments and can thrive in a variety of soil types. Dischidia deschampsii is often cultivated as a houseplant or in hanging baskets due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
